events.description: Release of Indonesia's fourth-quarter GDP data scheduled for Thursday.
A major disaster that occurred in Sumatra late last year, impacting economic growth expectations.
Government allocation of IDR 12.83 trillion for a stimulus package in Q1 2026.

facts.fact_text: Indonesia's IDX Composite hovered near 8,116 after a 2.5% surge in the prior session.

evidences.evidence_text: Indonesia’s IDX Composite was little changed in Wednesday morning trade, hovering near 8,116 after surging 2.5% in the prior session.

facts.fact_text: The government allocated IDR 12.83 trillion for a stimulus package in Q1 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: the government reportedly allocated IDR 12.83 trillion for a stimulus package in Q1 2026

facts.fact_text: Astrindo Nusantara shares slumped 11.9%, while Bank Central Asia rose 1.6%.

evidences.evidence_text: Astrindo Nusantara slumped 11.9%... gains in major lenders, with Bank Central Asia rising 1.6%

claims.claim_text: The Q4 GDP is expected to show economic expansion at a slower pace due to the Sumatra disaster.
claims.author: Market Investors

evidences.evidence_text: expected to show the economy continuing to expand but at a slower pace following the major disaster in Sumatra late last year

claims.claim_text: The stimulus package is aimed at supporting domestic demand.
claims.author: Government Report

evidences.evidence_text: aimed at supporting domestic demand through transportation ticket discounts, toll road tariff cuts, and the accelerated disbursement of social assistance

evidence.evidence_text: expected to show the economy continuing to expand but at a slower pace following the major disaster in Sumatra late last year
aimed at supporting domestic demand through transportation ticket discounts
Investors awaited Q4 GDP data on Thursday
